username.description: Bitbucket username. Either username/password or Access Token must be provided.

token.title: Access Token
token.description: Personal Access Token for Bitbucket Server API authentication. See https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/personal-access-tokens-939515499.html for information on how to generate this token.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Keys of your Bitbucket Server projects

repositories.title: Repositories
repositories.description: Names of your Bitbucket repositories in the format 'project-key/repo-slug'. If you want to pull all repositories from a project, you can add the project key to the Projects list instead of listing the repositories here

cutoff_days.title: Cutoff Days
cutoff_days.description: Only fetch data updated after cutoff

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Page size to use when requesting records from Bitbucket Server API

max_retries.title: Max Retries
max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries for requests to Bitbucket Server API that get rate limited or encounter connection issues

reject_unauthorized.title: Enforce Certificate Validation
reject_unauthorized.description: Enforce certificate validation for the Bitbucket Server

bucket_id.title: Bucket Number
bucket_id.description: Bucket number for this source to determine which portion of repositories to pull. Use it when distributing the load between multiple sources.

bucket_total.title: Total Number of Buckets
bucket_total.description: Total number of buckets to distribute repositories across. Use it when distributing the load between multiple sources

round_robin_bucket_execution.title: Round Robin Bucket Execution
round_robin_bucket_execution.description: When enabled, syncs rotate through all buckets, processing one bucket per sync. When disabled, only the bucket specified by 'bucket_id' is synced.

bucket_ranges.title: Bucket Ranges
bucket_ranges.description: List of bucket ranges to process when round robin bucket execution is enabled. Each element can be either a single bucket number (e.g., '7') or a range of buckets (e.g., '3-5'). All bucket numbers must be between 1 and 'bucket_total'.
